stateCompliance.headline: California Payday Loan Regulations
stateCompliance.intro: Residents of San Bernardino are protected by California's strict payday loan regulations enforced by the Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI).
stateCompliance.content: California regulates payday loans under the California Deferred Deposit Transaction Law (CDDTL), administered by the Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI). The state allows payday loans with significant consumer protections: loans are capped at $300 with a maximum fee of 15% (approximately $45). Rollovers are prohibited, meaning lenders cannot issue a new loan to pay off an existing one. California also prohibits lenders from making multiple loans to the same borrower simultaneously. All payday lenders operating in California must be licensed by the DFPI, and consumers can verify a lender's license status online or by calling 1-866-275-2677.
keyPoints: California limits payday loans to a maximum of $300
The maximum fee is 15% of the check amount (up to $45)
Lenders cannot make a new loan to pay off an existing loan (rollovers prohibited)
You cannot have more than one payday loan at a time
If your check bounces, the lender can charge only one NSF fee of up to $15
Lenders cannot threaten criminal prosecution for non-payment
Your loan contract must be provided in your primary language
All lenders must be licensed - verify at dfpi.ca.gov
stateCompliance.regulatoryBody: California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI)
stateCompliance.disclaimer: IMPORTANT NOTICE: This information is provided for general educational purposes only and does not constitute legal or financial advice. Payday loans are high-cost, short-term loans with APRs that can exceed 400%. Before taking out a payday loan, consider alternatives such as personal loans, credit union loans, payment plans with creditors, or assistance from non-profit credit counseling agencies. Laws and regulations may change. For the most current information, contact the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation at 1-866-275-2677 or visit dfpi.ca.gov.

nearbyLocations.intro: Can't make it to our San Bernardino location? We also serve:

faq.question: Where is your San Bernardino payday loan location?
faq.answer: Our San Bernardino branch is located at 456 E Street, Suite 101, near the Original McDonald's Site and Museum and the California Theatre. Take I-10 Exit 75 (Downtown) or I-215 Exit 45 (Baseline) for the quickest route.

faq.question: How much can I borrow at your San Bernardino location?
faq.answer: Under California law, the maximum payday loan amount is $300, with a maximum fee of $45 (15%). You'll receive approximately $255 after the fee is deducted. We clearly explain all terms before you sign.

faq.question: What do I need to bring to get a payday loan in San Bernardino?
faq.answer: Bring a valid California ID, proof of income (pay stub or bank statement), an active checking account, and contact information. We'll verify your information and can have you approved in about 30 minutes.

faq.question: Do you serve other cities near San Bernardino?
faq.answer: Yes! We serve customers throughout San Bernardino County including Fontana, Rialto, Highland, Colton, Redlands, and Ontario. Our central Downtown location is easily accessible from I-10 and I-215.

faq.question: Is Ace Payday Loans licensed in California?
faq.answer: Yes, Ace Payday Loans is fully licensed by the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI) under the California Deferred Deposit Transaction Law. You can verify our license at dfpi.ca.gov.
